thread.title: Boston-area museum removes all art created by immigrants - National | Globalnews.ca
thread.title_full: Boston-area museum removes all art created by immigrants - National | Globalnews.ca

author: Tania Kohut
title: Boston-area museum removes all art created by immigrants - National | Globalnews.ca
text:
Listen 
The Davis Museum in Wellesley, Mass., has gaping blank spaces on its walls, empty podiums and shrouded pieces of work after removing or covering all art that was created or donated by immigrants . 
The #artless movement aims to provide a visual representation of cultural contributions immigrants have made to the U.S. — and the gaps that would be left without them. 
READ MORE: ‘A Day Without Immigrants’ protest shuts down businesses across US 
The museum is taking a stand against growing anti-immigrant rhetoric in the United States, and President Donald Trump ‘s ongoing travel ban efforts. 
“For the days leading up to and including the Presidents’ Day holiday weekend we have removed or cloaked these works to demonstrate symbolically what the Davis Museum would look like without their contributions to our collections and to Wellesley College,” the museum said in a statement. ‘A Day Without immigrants’ movement held across U.S. in response to Trump’s immigration platform
